text: Noticed various small UI issues with text. Since I have permission, I fixed the d.o module page right away: <https://www.drupal.org/docs/contributed-modules/announcements-feed> — this is the page where the core patch links to, so that will need to get fixed as well (its not a contributed module anymore). If we are to keep this page separately, then some of  the info needs to be different in the two.

— this is the page where the core patch links to, so that will need to get fixed as well (its not a contributed module anymore). If we are to keep this page separately, then some of  the info needs to be different in the two.

attachments.title: Announcements Feed
attachments.text: Provides an interface as part of the administrator toolbar for viewing announcements from the Drupal project. The list of announcements is provided from <http://drupal.org|drupal.org> and may provide information about upcoming releases, new feature highlights, events like DrupalCon, and promote support of the project via Association membership or other programs. It was originally developed as the Announce ontributed module. There are no settings in the module, the <http://drupal.org|drupal.org> source feed location is built-in. Users may configure which user roles have access to the announcement list in the toolbar.

text:
<@U06HDFAP5> <@U1A7P6GTZ> We are following the same process that we did for ckeditor5 module development.

i.e. we create the issue in module’s issue queue. Later after merging we create a patch for main issue via a shell script.

In our case, we have module <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce|here>, and <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3238706|this is> the shell script that <@U4PT7ES0M> uses it to create the patch.

elements.text:

attachments.title: Various documentation fixes
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation The module description is incorrect and the help could use some improvement. The core module should not link to documentation on a contributed project, this needs some kind of solution, possibly in the core patch script. Steps to reproduce Proposed resolution Remaining tasks User interface changes API changes Data model changes

text: While doing that, noticed <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3249532> which is odd, should be discussed

elements.text: While doing that, noticed
which is odd, should be discussed

attachments.title: Should not display ALL the announcements(?)
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation The module currently displays all the announcements from <http://drupal.org|drupal.org>. Is the idea that the announcement feed itself will have controls / limits as to what it contains and thus limit what is displayed on the site? If so, we should include that somehow in the documentation as well. Noticed while working on [#3249521]. If the feed keeps growing, then we need a Drupal site-side solution to limit the items. Steps to reproduce Proposed resolution Remaining tasks User interface changes API changes Data model changes
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Should not display ALL the announcements(?)

attachments.title: Toggle announcement dialog on clicking toolbar link
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation When Announcement dialog is open on clicking the Announcements link multiple times in the toolbar does not do anything. Steps to reproduce 1. On 1st click of Announcements link dialog opens up. 2. On 2nd click of Announcements link nothing happens. Proposed resolution The off-canvas dialog should toggle on clicking Announcements link. Remaining tasks User interface changes API changes Data model changes
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Toggle announcement dialog on clicking toolbar link
